snippet: A “tea master,” Mr. Fleming’s legendary taste determined the tea used by the Thomas J. Lipton Company.
abstract: Noble Fleming, arbiter of tea taste for Thomas J Lipton Co, dies at age 92.

headline.main: Noble Fleming, Arbiter of Tea Taste, Dies at 92
headline.print_headline: Noble Fleming, 92, Arbiter of Tea Taste

snippet: Two congressmen sent Apple a followup letter Wednesday asking Timothy Cook, Apple’s chief executive, to answer questions about privacy problems within the company’s iTunes App Store.
abstract: Two congressmen sent Apple a followup letter Wednesday asking Timothy Cook, Apple’s chief executive, to answer questions about privacy problems within the company’s iTunes App Store.

headline.main: Congress Presses Apple on App Privacy

snippet: The new iPad’s technical improvements keep it at the forefront of desirability — just ahead of the snapping jaws of its Android competition — but don’t take it in any new directions.
abstract: David Pogue State of the Art column contends the third generation iPad's technical improvements keep it at the forefront of desirability--just ahead of the snapping jaws of its Android competition--but do not take it in any new directions; points out the biggest new feature is the Retina display, which is the sharpest screen ever on a mobile device.

headline.main: New iPad: A Polishing of the Old
headline.print_headline: New iPad: A Polishing Of the Old

snippet: Guests came from both sides of the Atlantic for a White House dinner honoring the British prime minister.
abstract: Guests came from both sides of the Atlantic for a White House dinner honoring the British prime minister.

headline.main: Guest List for State Dinner Includes Big Names and Ordinary People

snippet: New software goes far beyond simply tracking speed and distance.
abstract: Bob Tedeschi App Smart column highlights running apps, noting they go far beyond simply tracking speed and distance.

headline.main: Achieving a Runner’s High With a Little Data Help
headline.print_headline: Achieving a Runner’s High With a Little Data Help

snippet: The vast majority of the more than 1,200 acts performing on, it seems, every level surface in Austin — clubs, warehouses, backyards, a bridge — are still hopefuls.
abstract: The vast majority of the more than 1,200 acts performing on, it seems, every level surface in Austin — clubs, warehouses, backyards, a bridge — are still hopefuls.

snippet: The Jabra Supreme Bluetooth earpiece has better-than-usual sound, but other problems outweigh that.

headline.main: The Jabra Supreme With a Boom Is a Bust
headline.print_headline: Wireless Headset Comes With a Boom, And With Problems

snippet: The Federal Reserve’s brighter economic outlook and recent stock market strength drove investors away from government debt.
abstract: Major stock averages end essentially flat, as investors move away from government debt.

headline.main: Shares End Mostly Flat as the S.&P. Breaks Its Winning Streak
headline.print_headline: Shares End Mostly Flat as the S.&P. Breaks Its Winning Streak

snippet: Competition authorities are asking if a series of meetings national operators have held on strategy and technical co-operation constituted collusion.

headline.main: European Antitrust Regulators Question Phone Operators
headline.print_headline: European Antitrust Regulators Question Phone Operators

snippet: Stocks climbed to new heights in part on rosy retail sales data, pushing the broad market to levels last seen in June 2008 and the Nasdaq composite index past the 3,000 milestone for the first time since 2000.
abstract: Stocks climb on strong retail sales data, pushing the broad market to levels last seen in June 2008; Nasdaq composite index closes at 3,039.88, first time since 2000 that it finishes over 3,000, when the Internet bubble burst and the index plummeted nearly 40 percent.

headline.main: Nasdaq Finishes Above 3,000, Its Best Since Dot-Com Bubble
headline.print_headline: Nasdaq Finishes Above 3,000, Its Best Since Dot-Com Bubble
